name: Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun
description: Shadow Tactics is a hardcore tactical stealth game set in Japan around the Edo period. A new Shogun seizes power over Japan and enforces nationwide peace. In his battle against conspiracy and rebellion, he recruits five specialists with extraordinary skills for assassination, sabotage and espionage.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista 64-bit Processor: Intel i3 2nd-Generation 2.5GHz, AMD Quad-Core 2.5GHz Memory: 4 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GT640, AMD Radeon HD7750, 1GB Vram DirectX: Version 10 Storage: 13 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c Compatible Sound Card with Latest Drivers
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 64-bit or higher, Windows 8, Windows 10 Processor: Intel i3 4th-Generation 3.5GHz, AMD Quad-Core 3.9GHz Memory: 6 GB RAM Graphics: Nvidia GTX 570, AMD Radeon HD 6950, 2GB Vram DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 13 GB available space Sound Card: DirectX 9.0c Compatible Sound Card with Latest Drivers Additional Notes: Installing the game on an SSD improves loading times.

reviews.review_text: Excellent game. Reminds me of a game called desperados set in the wild west. I have been waitning for a game like that for a long time. Plays beautifully. Excellent art style with crisp visuals.

Great game, amazing level design, but make no mistake about what you're getting. This is pretty much a puzzle game. If you like looking at complex, interconnected systems and figuring out how to systematically dismantle them, then this game will be right up your alley.

Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun  is extremely well designed. The levels are amazing, the art direction is spot on, the difficulty is just right. A brilliant tactical game. But maybe most of all, the characters and the story are fantastic. A great setting, amazing direction and execution.  Mimimi Productions  are clearly talented and passionate. I would hope for more of Shadow Tactics, and will come back for more.  Oh, and  thank you  for giving us the japanese audio with english subtitles. If I knew nothing else of this game, this alone would be enough.

This game is the best Stealth Game in my Opinion, Because it is in the Shogun era. It is very difficult and you need a whole while until you have achieved a level. Goal to success is to make mistakes and to learn from them and from the characters, You also have to pay attention to the environment that saves your progress and often use quicksave.   I do not want to say more in order not to spoil your fun  It is highly recommended to player who like Stealth games or the Shogun era.  For those who are unsure, i would recomment a sale event mind you, you need lots of patience otherwise you won` t have fun with this purchase.

Great game, love the art.  Runs smooth while loading times ( first time) can be quite long.  While there are a few skills per character you play I don't feel like there is a need for more. Edit : By now ive finished the game, atleast my first playthrough. already completly hyped for hard mode! the level design is beatiful and you can see (and feel ingame) there has been spent quite some time on it, very well done!  If your afraid of the possible low amount of hours you might spend on it , well I gues its based on person.. but there is quite some replayability. You got night,snow,normal maps combined with always having multiple ways to complete a mission. not one road that loads to victory. Challenges will need you atleast 3 playthroughs to complete. (complete stealth missions no kills , dont touch X , timed runs , dont use X char, etc.) which forces you to play different then you might be used to , fun!  ow yah the story aint bad either,dont expect skyrim/the witcher etc. for its genre its well filled with lore.  The steam page/videos give you not enough insight in my opinion, try the free demo!  Don't pirate this , support the dev's they deserve it =)
It's Commandos in Feudal Japan
so far so good ... really loved commandos 1,2 & 3... well done devs for bringing a dead genre back into existence with flying colors :)

This is the best isometric stealth real-time tactics game to come around in a while. The missions are challenging and varied and the stages gorgeous. Great Japanese voice acting and an Edo period setting buttress an engaging story with interesting and endearing characters.   The tale begins with a tutorial mission in which one of the five playable characters aids an assault on Osaka castle led by another member of what will become the Shogun's elite team, in order to seize it and install your daimyo as Shogun. You'll then embark on the uncovering and unraveling of a plot against the Shogun after a successful period of his administration.   The story is quite well-written and the setting, art style, and voice acting make it very immersive.   On the gameplay side, I've often been amazed at how long I've spent on a level, after observing, planning, executing, and retrying even seemingly small engagements in order to get them right in what are often very small exploitable windows of time requiring instantaneous coordination between two or more of the five playable characters. Thankfully, there's a 'shadow mode' during which you can queue up actions for each character before hitting 'enter' to watch them be carried out simultaneously.  As to downsides, I haven't found many. It can be quite challenging at times, but not so much in an 'RNG' way that feels unfair. Every problem has at least one solution, and almost all appear to have multiple, so if you stick with it and plan patiently you'll succeed. Names and details of the Edo period setting have been changed, so you're not serving Tokugawa Ieyasu as such, but this isn't a historical simulator and the details that are present more than suffice to make the story and gameplay immersive. I have encountered a few areas in which I can do things I clearly shouldn't be able to, such as knock out a civilian on a balcony and then throw her down between two buildings in an area with no visible gap, where she then gets stuck and can no longer witness my systematic dispatching of the guards. The loading times for the first playthrough of a new mission can sometimes take up to about 120 seconds, but this is a one-time inconvenience. In fact, I'd say the game is optimized very well as I'm running on a graphics card (Radeon HD6870) that sits below that of the minimum recommended system requirements (HD7750) and am able to run the game on high-max settings with no performance issues.  Although I'm still only on my first playthrough, that the replay value is high is immediately obvious, with each level having multiple paths to the objective(s), and several challenges per level ranging from unique environmental kills to extremely difficult time hacks for speedruns. This game will give back a lot of fun hours of play for its fairly modest price tag. If you enjoyed games like those from the  Commandos  series, are interested in Edo period Japanese history, or both (like myself), you won't regret this purchase in the slightest.  9/10 Highly recommend!
Definately one of the best games of 2016.

Oh boy, overall, this game is a stunning masterpiece. I have so much to say about this game, but let's narrow it down to a few points.   Starting with the positive aspects: - Storyline,   Amazing   13/10. I personally loved the story. It is undescribable, especially at around the climax. - gameplay, a huge variaty of strategies even when the game is based on stealth. The developers created the obstacles, and the rest is for you to overcome them however you want. - hints, the game provides you with key objects/locations as hints to help you get through a level that you may be stuck on. - difficulty, this game is generally difficult for me when I played on normal difficulty, it required alot of thinking and strategy, which is the exact reason why I found myself coming back to this game everyday.  - voice acting, the voices of the characters are well-designed, not just the protagonsists but also the enemies. It really puts a sense of reality in the game.   For some negative points I came across: - there are some glitches of enemies where they would become 'stuck', making it impossible for me to get through a chokepoint unnoticed because they wont look away - controls, this is just a personal opinion, I find it a little annoying when I try to click on the ground beside a hook ring and my mouse snaps onto the hookring instead of my actual target.   It is important to note for reference that it took me 25 hours of gameplay to beat this game on a first playthrough on normal difficulty. There are 9 achievements for each of the 10 levels to be completed in alternative playthroughs. Personally I don't feel like going back to complete them but I'm certain this is a good concept for players who likes challenges.
Yup, the hype is real. Storyline, audio, graphics, gameplay, UI - everything is top notch. Buy this great game and support good devs. Highly reccomend.

HEY DEVS OUT THERE! DEMOS WORK. NEVER WOULD HAVE EVEN TRIED THIS GAME HAD IT NOT HAD A DEMO. HOLY ♥♥♥♥ IM HAVING A GOOD TIME. I would encourage everyone to download the demo here and give this game a whirl. Most interesting and fun stealth game I have played in a very long time. The controls are a bit of a hurdle and you need to laern to use the camera well or else you're going to miss guards and click on the environment instead of your character. I implore you to give the demo a try, this game is much deeper than it's generic Title entails. If you don't end every mission lighting a cigar and saying 'I love it when a plan comes together', you're doing it wrong.
If you liked Commandos, this is the game for you.
Fantastic game but devs for the love of god PLEASE give us the option to pause during Shadow Mode!

This has been practically ALL I have wanted to do since I bought it, borderline all I have thought about at work, and been the biggest source of regret for when I have to go to bed (because 'adult responsibilities' and 'mortgage' or whatever). I saw it out of nowhere because Steam insidiously knows what I like, and I took the shot and man am I glad I did.  The gameplay is amazing. It's real time stealth tactical, so you have five dudes (once you get everybody), a classic ninja (throws shuriken, stabs people up real good, can make enemies look a certain direction with a stone throw), a thief (sets traps, stabs people up real good, can draw people to a spot with a bird whistle), a samurai (is the only dude who can fight enemy samurai one-on-one, stabs people up real good, and has a whirlwind slash that can take out all enemies in a small circular area), a kunoichi (does disguises to hide in plain sight/talk to guards to distract them, stabs people up real good, and has a sight-diminishing tech that reduces enemies vision cones briefly), and a sniper (crippled and so can't climb walls or use grappling hooks, but stabs people u-- er, fills people fulla holes real good, can do bombs, and has a startlingly performance-capable tanuki for complex kiting maneuvers to get enemies away from their buddies to facilitate being stabbed up real good).   Everybody has unique talents, and what's really cool is you'll likely find some combination that fits your preferred playing style. I stuck with the shinobi and thief most, because pulling people into a knife-launching spring trap, hucking a shuriken into one dude's throat and then stabbing his attendant in the space of about one-point-four seconds is immensely satisfying. That said, you could just as easily take the kunoichi and the sniper, and have her distract one of the guards watching the target while he puts a bullet in his head from a tower four hundred yards away. Go nuts. Or don't kill anyone and ghost your way through the levels if you're one of those non-stabbing weirdos society keeps talking about.  The levels get pretty huge, and it's honestly daunting in the later ones. While 13 levels may not sound like a lot, each of them took me an average of an hour and change (longer when I deliberately choose to hunt the enemy population to extinction); the last level literally took me two and a half hours. And the first 20 MINUTES was just looking at all the dudes and trying to find a weak link.  I'll grant, this brings me to my ONE major complaint, and it didn't keep me from enjoying it, but it was annoying: the enemy layouts are SUPER manufactured. It doesn't take long for it to start, it just gets more and more compounded as time goes on; everybody is being watched by somebody. Even enemies that move are perfectly synched up with other dudes so that someone is always keeping an eye on them, and murdering someone takes a second (go figure). Enemy vision cones have a hashed region where, if you're crouching, they can't see you there, and if a corpse is on the ground there, fine, but they take so long to fall over, enemies WILL twig that Dave is clearly spurting blood from his carotid just before he finally keels over and alert the whole damn castle. It can honestly get ridiculous in later levels where enemy vision cones are so insanely large that you'll watch a dude for ten minutes, making sure he's isolated enough to take down, so you take down the guy HE'S watching, who's watching and being watching in turn by those two dudes in the courtyard, finally make a move, and then some random jackass will see it from honestly two-hundred-and-change yards. It can really get infuriating. But on the upside, this forces you to utilize the five characters' worth of skills you have in creative ways. You don't so much find a weak link in the chain of enemies so much as MAKE one by employing a strategy and a BIT of save-scumming.   Okay, to be honest, you're going to wear the print off your F5 and F8 keys. But it's quick enough and you adapt quickly that moves you'd never think possible hour 2 only take an extra try or so to pull off. And holy ♥♥♥♥, it feels good. Shadow Mode comes in pretty heavily there; it lets you queue up one action per character and it'll all fire off the second you hit Enter. It's genuinely Rube Goldberg-esque, only with more flying fatality and pointy bits going into people.  The English voice acting is more than competent; player characters sound a little better, but that's not surprising. Gonna do another playthrough with it set to Japanese out of nothing more than curiosity, but I really dig the sound design. Effects are cool, too. I love the whisk-sklurtch of Hayato's shuriken. Satisfying in a way I'm not sure is entirely socially-acceptable.  Only other complaint I had, and it's a tiny one, is that since you have free-camera control, it's possible to have locations of different elevation between your camera and the point you're clicking on, so the game with think you're trying to move onto the roof of a tower nearby, when you're clicking on a point further down the road your selected character is on, and your character won't move, instead voicing protest that the whole 'ninja can teleport' myth is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. This gets frustrating when you get blindsided by a patrolling dude going 'HEY IS THAT A HITMAN OVER THERE' (enemies spotting you has a yellow wave slink up the green of the cone and if it hits your character, you're spotted) and you tell Aiko '♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ ♥♥♥♥ MOVE MOVE MOVE' and she just goes 'I CAN'T DO THAT; ♥♥♥♥'S SAKE IT'S THREE STORIES UP' because your camera had the curtain wall of the castle sort of in the cursor's way and you get spotted and hit F8 and sullenly correct your rotation again before retrying the maneuver. VERY minor issue, but it IS there. On the upside, it'll teach you how to enter enemy sight ranges just long enough to get from A to B, because if you get out before the warning wave hits you, you're fine. When you're really good, you can 'surf', sticking juuuuuuust on the edge where their normal vision diminishes to half-vision (the hashed region) and you can move with them to move between patrols. It's really tight.  Story's genuinely neat. Stuff happened that I didn't see coming and it was well-written and didn't feel cheap. That alone qualifies it as good story to me. I also liked being assassins for the established government instead of the cliche' 'the ruler is bad we need to kill him because rebels are automatically purer of heart'. I prefer being a government assassin, which I can't say I've been able to do since the Morag Tong in Morrowind. ♥♥♥♥, I should play Morrowind again.  Anyway, I can't say enough good about it. There were times where I was fuming and hammering the quickload keys multiple times a minute (it auto-cycles a set of three saves, which is a ♥♥♥♥ing godsend; reflexively hitting F5 to save and getting blindsided won't ruin your run), but I never ragequitted, and bad moods were always superseded by joy and fulfillment at finding a way around the AI trying to give itself all the advantages to your detriment. There were times I was really thirsty for a pause button, ala Pillars of Eternity, for instance, but that would defeat the purpose, I get it. You adapt surprisingly quickly, and it's a really rewarding game to be good at.  I know I'm biased because I immediately start frothing at the mouth when someone says 'There's ninjas', but this could be Street Bum Simulator and if it was written this well and played this engagingly, I'd still love the ♥♥♥♥ out of it.  It's just better with ninjas.  9.7/10.

First things first, let me make one thing clear... although alot of reviewers call this a RTS, it most definately is not, Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun is a TACTICS game remeniscent of the old Commandoes and Desperados games. If you are looking for an actual RTS you won't find it in this game.  You control up to 5 characters, each with different skills to complete your task often needing them to work in tandem (wich there is a gamemechanic in place for) and it's a blast to pull off a well planned move with multiple characters at once.  The missions are pretty interesting and they fit around the story that enfolds. I personally saw the plottwist in the story comming a mile away but it still didn't take away anything from the overall experience since the most enjoyment will be from the actual gameplay.  I have spent 31h to complete one playthrough, and there definately is replayability either to get badges (challenges) by doing/not doing certain actions during missions or by simply trying out a another route to your target.  This game is a prime example of a cheap indie games just stomping on most AAA titles in terms of value, fun and gameplay.  I can't really say anything negative about the title based on what it sells for and what it is intended to be. The few quirks I had with it like missing hotkeys for selecting all characters at once, some ui annoyances etc have all been patched in as of writing this review.  So I can't recommend this enough if you are into tactics games. I'm glad atleast one game in this genre is made and I really hope for more.

Wow! Not only was this an amazingly well-designed and enjoyable game, it was also a fantastic experience. After playing XCOM: Enemy Unknown, I was thirsty for more strategy-based games. Aside from Invisible, Inc. and Steamworld Heist, I had no other experience with these types of games. After seeing a review for Shadow Tactics on YouTube by a reviewer by the name of ACG (Angry Centaur Gaming), it piqued my interest. Steam was accommodating enough to host a Demo. It was definitely strategical. It took me almost 2 hours for just the first mission! The demo was enough to prompt me to purchase the entire game at a slight discount (15% off I think).  The game is classified as real-time strategy, as opposed to turn-based strategy. This is the main difference from the aforementioned games - it is free-flowing, and can get quite intense! It has a compelling story based in the Japanese lore of Shogun dynasties and the wars waged to protect them. Below is my list of pros and cons:  Pros: - Brilliant level design - devs meticulously crafted these levels to exploit each game character's skill, in turn, tediously forcing the player to explore every action. This is a hardcore strat game, don't be fooled. But, when you complete a level (and the game), it's oh so rewarding! - Graphics are stupendous. With a decent gaming rig, this game runs like butter when in play (see save / load comments in cons). The title screen, alone, is almost worth a quarter-price of admission! - Fantastic characters (5 + 1/2 - the racoon:)) with subtle nuances to personality, suggesting a rich back-story. With this comes a unique set of skills for each that require the player to master. - Voice acting and narration were cinema quality - bravo to the devs! - Score was swelling and breath-taking - like much of the graphical view.  Cons: - As I stated, the game runs silky smooth when in play. The load times and saves (quick or manual) get bogged over time. The game encourages savescumming with a little timer announcing the last save. Again, the game is a beast of a challenge, so you'll need to save...and save often! I read a number of threads re. these load and save times, and found it was most likely due to the way I have the game installed. I have the main game on my HDD, while Steam is on my SSD boot. Games, by default, use the Steam drive for saves. I believe, as I accrued almost 3-4GB of saves, the interplay between the game on the HDD and the save SSD in collaboration with the Steam server and cloud sync, caused the load and save times to suffer. So, I moved a good portion of my old saves to another drive to clear up my SSD drive...this seemed to speed the load times to within 10 seconds and save times to within a couple seconds. It's kind of a minor thing, but finding the silly save files was kind of like finding a needle in a haystack. For future players, Steam games typically store save files in Users/<your name>/AppData/Local/<game folder>. The tricky part in locating it was that the folder was titled 'Daedalic Entertainment GMBH' - the dev. - Because each level is so intricate and loaded in entirety, the control of the camera to angle that perfect strategy can be a bit cumbersome, but nothing show-stopping.  If you have time and patience to invest, and want a challenge unlike most other contemporary games, at least try the demo. Each level took me an average of 2-3 hours to complete - at least that's what the game stats showed; however, it was most likely longer because of all the savescumming. Honestly, this game embodied the epitome of what video games should be - strategic, cognitively challenging, enthralling story, engaging characters, amazing play mechanics and more! Again, try the demo.
Worthy spiritual successor to commandos which improves upon it with a good story, strong characters, and a solid interface. Then there is soundtrack which is absolutely divine.

I hate this game, its very hard. Developers suggest fast playtime for mission ~ around 15 minutes... I completed mine in 1 HOUR, 44 MINUTES AND 58 SECONDS  P.S. This game have actual traces from snow, and they really impact the gameplay, because guards notice these traces... 10/10 would lure in to my samurai trap again with snow traces
An excelent game from an underepresented genre.   Buy it now so we can have more Commandos 'clones', please!

This game, like the commandos series, is just great i can spend up to 3hours on a single level just learning the enemy movments. the characters have each got a unique character that you cant help but roleplay them all. I may only like this game because of its difficlty but....... I dont know where i am going with this. if you like difficult games and tactics PLAY THIS GAME

Enjoying this game so much that I probably can't explain in a review but this is something absolutely worth supporting. Ever since Commandos games became history, I was missing this genre so much and I am glad this game is reviving it. Not only that it's going to the roots of the genre. I am going to write Pros and Cons about it and hope you find them enough to get an idea about this game.  Pros  * Excellent story. * Amazing characters. * Rewarding gameplay, requires you to think and make a strategy. * Great voice acting, some short conversations take place during missions that are really fun to listen. * A variety of tools available at your disposal to plan your approach, makes it fun and creative at the same time. * Great level design and locations. * Beautiful and crisp visuals set in feudal Japan. * Perfect controls with Mouse and Keyboard, making us PC gamers feel at home. * Nice attention to animations. * Good music. * Respectable amount of graphic customization. * Very well optimized, playing it at max settings 4K DSR.  Cons  * Maybe short in length and that's what killing me already, don't want this game to end ever. * Could have a few more characters, it's not a con really but a desire to see more excitting characters.  And that's pretty much it. If devs are reading my review then I would like to say them thanks and please don't stop this franchise, I will support it forever and I am sure there will be more die hard fans of the genre and franchise, thanks for providing us what was forgotten.  Also a complaint to critics that Indie games like these need more press coverage than those so called AAA titles so please give it some attention.
I don't have time to write a long ♥♥♥ review. I love this game already and I just want to play it more! Bye!

This is a best stealth tactical hardcore game ever and I love it I also consider the story very importand for any game and it turn out this game has a best story ever.  I love how you can do your mission with many diffrent ways with your characters . all the characters of this game make you fell in love with them as they get to know each other and by time they notice it they are best team and friends.    The animation and the unique skills of chracters and music wow the music makes me want to play this game forever best game I have ever played set in shogun era as an asassin :]     Dear developers of this game keep up a amazing work like this just shut up and take my money £££££££££££££££££££££££££££££££££

This is a best stealth tactical hardcore game ever and I love it I also consider the story very importand for any game and it turn out this game has a best story ever.  I love how you can do your mission with many diffrent ways with your characters . all the characters of this game make you fell in love with them as they get to know each other and by time they notice it they are best team and friends.    The animation and the unique skills of chracters and music wow the music makes me want to play this game forever best game I have ever played set in shogun era as an asassin :]     Dear developers of this game keep up a amazing work like this just shut up and take my money £££££££££££££££££££££££££££££££££

If you love stealth or this kind of games like commandos, desperados, robin hood, you should definitely buy it. This game is the reborn of a genre. And i really hope we can see this type of games often.

A love song to tactical stealth game genre in general, and Commandos in particular. If you're into either of those, and like — or at least tolerate — Japanese setting, then this game is a must buy. There's very little to not to adore about it. And if you're still in doubt, just check the demo. It doesn't lie.
As mentioned in other reviews, if you played Commando back in the day this is a must buy.

I loved to play Commandos and Desperados back in the days. Now I finally got a new game of that type. Really well made and challenging so far, I enjoy it very much and can recommend it to everyone who likes tactical games. A free demo is also available, which is an awesome gesture.

Enjoying this game so much that I probably can't explain in a review but this is something absolutely worth supporting. Ever since Commandos games became history, I was missing this genre so much and I am glad this game is reviving it. Not only that it's going to the roots of the genre. I am going to write Pros and Cons about it and hope you find them enough to get an idea about this game.  Pros  * Excellent story. * Amazing characters. * Rewarding gameplay, requires you to think and make a strategy. * Great voice acting, some short conversations take place during missions that are really fun to listen. * A variety of tools available at your disposal to plan your approach, makes it fun and creative at the same time. * Great level design and locations. * Beautiful and crisp visuals set in feudal Japan. * Perfect controls with Mouse and Keyboard, making us PC gamers feel at home. * Nice attention to animations. * Good music. * Respectable amount of graphic customization. * Very well optimized, playing it at max settings 4K DSR.  Cons  * Maybe short in length and that's what killing me already, don't want this game to end ever. * Could have a few more characters, it's not a con really but a desire to see more excitting characters.  And that's pretty much it. If devs are reading my review then I would like to say them thanks and please don't stop this franchise, I will support it forever and I am sure there will be more die hard fans of the genre and franchise, thanks for providing us what was forgotten.  Also a complaint to critics that Indie games like these need more press coverage than those so called AAA titles so please give it some attention.

The reason this has overwhelmingly positive reviews is because people who buy this game are into this type of game. If you don't like slow tactical stealth games then this simply isn't for you and i would say avoid it. If using your brain more than your reflexes is something you like this game is just outstanding.

As a huge fan of Commandos, it's pretty much impossible to dislike this game (the only thing missing is the co-op feature Commandos had, as problematic as it was). It's a fresh take on everything that made Commandos great, and has a lot of modern improvements and polish (I especially like how much more replayability it has allowing you to take on earlier levels in different, more challenging ways with challenges/badges).  If you ever played and enjoyed Commandos, this is a no brainer pick up spiritual successor. If you have no idea what Commandos is, you can find out what you've been missing out on for free with the lengthy demo and make a choice from there, hopefully discover a great genre you may have missed out on since it's been pretty much dead for awhile until this game came out.  I really hope this is only the start of the revival of one of my favorite game types

Enjoying this game so much that I probably can't explain in a review but this is something absolutely worth supporting. Ever since Commandos games became history, I was missing this genre so much and I am glad this game is reviving it. Not only that it's going to the roots of the genre. Hard, but not too hard. In fact it's perfect. I loved Commandos and Desperados and this game is a great continuation of the genre.
remind me of the good old times playing the Commandos series. The settings and characters fits the tactical stealth genre perfectly, if you liked the Commandos games, you would love this.

I can't recommend this game enough. It's very well polished and lovingly crafted. Comparisons to the old Commandos games are apt, but what really surprised and delighted me was how well the characters were written. They each have their own personalities and react to each other and the changing situations differently. By the end of the game they had each grown on me quite a bit and I was sad to see them go.  'The road ahead is long... Why not travel together a bit longer, and say goodbye along the way?'

Excellent scenario design, well-chosen historical setting, and open-ended approach to your objectives makes for a winning combination. Every character has their own strengths and weaknesses, not to mention a personality that comes across well in-game. In all, a welcome successor to the venerable Commandos series, thankfully without the Green Beret's appalling Irish accent.

The comparison to Commandos is an obvious one, but the game this most reminds me of is Robin Hood: Legend of Sherwood from about 10 years ago. This is a stealth puzzler featuring 5 characters with unique abilities and 13 large, crafted maps. It's a lot of fun and certainly fits the bill for anyone who likes a tactical challenge. The levels are long too - 5.6 hours in and I'm still on the third level. Highly recommended, very polished and entertaining gem.

Samurai can see thru Aiko's disguise... Get Mugen to toss boulder on Samurai. Aiko flirts with nearby guard with clear view of body... Guard is entranced by Aiko.. Realism 10/10.  In all honesty, this game is great. Been having a blast testing out different strategies and approaches to missions, and it gets even crazier when trying to get all the 'badges' or achievements for every mission. A truly great game for the RTS fan in us all.
Most underappreciated game in 2016 Exotic artstlye, competant writing and carefully placed mechanisms makes this a perfect strategy game.
Good gameplay Good graphics Replayability Long campaign  Its good
Alright, time to stealthily assassinate the key targets... by killing every man, woman and child that gets in my way.   Also, Saké.
First ten seconds of the game:  *Unsheathes katana* *Sneaks up behind guard*  'Nothing personell...'  10/10
Been playing on hardcore as soon as I got in Takes me longer than an hour to beat one level very mad, few holes punched in wall reloaded at least 30 times  10/10 would recommend.
Requires tactics and calm mind. You will keep failing no matter what, but no worries. SPAM F5 for quick save for every single move and load quick if u fail.

I love this game. If you ever played the Robin Hood tactical game, the Commandos series and especially if you love the medieval Japan environment, then this is the game for you. Plus developers give you an option to beat all levels in different playstyle and encourage the variety by rewarding you with different badges, which to me is very satisfying. Game design, the visuals, music, different playstyle characters really make this a wonderful game. Highly recommend it.

Took me about 2 hrs to complete the first mission because I was not quite familiar with getting the right angle by rotating camera, and the keyboard settings are new to me as well :) Nevertheless, I would say that this is definitely one of the best games I've ever played. If you really have a thing for ninja stuff and stealth/strategy kinda games, this one is a must to play. 10/10

I personally love this game very much. I missed the Commandos gameplay for a long time, and this one is catching me because I love the culture and the story very much. And actually ninjas fit the gameplay quite well. The levels are well designed, not too hard with normal mode but still very challenging.
Moaning underaged girls and brutal alpha males. What's not to like.

Havent had so much fun playing a game since witcher 3, buy it!!
Only played 3 missions so far, but I'm loving it. If you're a fan of Commandos, this game is for you.
Very fun game, only the story is too sad...... want multiple endings!
a cool stealth tactics game that came out of nowhere  try the demo
Tried to kill all the bad guys early like an ultimate ninja and ended up causing a time paradox. 10/10 Would masscare for time paradox again.

This game is just brilliant. Its really challanging  I have only played 1.5 hour but man enjoying this game. there is a demo if you want to give it a try. I use a controller because thats what suits me love it x D Ah man co-op would be a blash x D. Give it a try 8.5/10

- 1 Diced Onion - 1 Diced Green Capsicum - Premium Beef Mince - Pasta Sauce (Spicy) - Cayenne Pepper - Penne Pasta - Garlic Granules - Olive Oil - Salt  Heat the olive oil in a pot until warm. Dice the onion and add to the pot. Cook slowly until soft and clear. Add the mince, stir through the onion and cook until the mince has browned. Add cayenne pepper (to taste) and stir through. Boil a jug of water. Add the pasta sauce and the diced capsicum. Add garlic granules (to taste) and stir everything thoroughly. Bring to the boil, then reduce heat and let the sauce simmer until capsicum has turned soft. Turn the heat off and let the sauce cool down while stirring every 2 minutes. Add boiled water to a separate pot. Add a pinch of salt and a tablespoon of olive oil to the water. Cook the penne pasta until soft. While the pasta is cooking, keep stirring the sauce and keep a lid on the pot to keep the heat in. Once the pasta has cooked, drain the water and add the pasta to the pasta sauce. Mix the pasta and the sauce thoroughly. Heat bowls in a microwave for 40 seconds. Serve into bowls accordingly. Sprinkle grated parmesan cheese over the top of the pasta/sauce mix. Eat.

Because of this game I wished Steam offered a mixed option, not just the thumb up and down.  Pros: - Graphics, this game has a stunning cell shader art style and colour contrast.  - Controls are very straight forward. - Gameplay is fun, strategic and satisfying. - Japanese setting is done correctly.   Cons: - Length, this game has a screen where it offers the missions of the campaine but when the game is finished the amount of missions doesn't fill the page, it doesn't even fill half the page. And then the game is over, there is nothing else to do except campaine.  - Story, the game starts straight forward, then a plot swist happens and i was surprised, then the game continues and then you kill the bad guy and the end. But it is anti-climatic and the length of this game truly damages it's story. - Overpriced. - No DLC or Updates.   Overall after playing this game i feel empty or disapointment. And I am sure it was because of the flop ending to the so far good story. I recomend this game when there is a sale and it is $20 or below.

This is an amazing game! I would recommend this to anyone who loves either puzzle-games or stealth-games. Every level can be completed in a large number of ways and therefore has lots of replayability (the game awards achievements for different approaches). It's hard to explain how much satisfaction you get when the planned-out actions of 3 characters all line up perfectly to kill multiple gaurds while not being spotted making you feel like a ninja-mastermind. There is a lot of trial and error though, so don't expect things to work the first time you try something, or the tenth time....... but if you keep at it, you'll have an excellent time with this game! Worth every cent.
Gameplay like the old commandos series, but better!

I always wanted to enjoy commandos but found it too frustrating, somehow even though this is frustrating its really enjoyable! The graphics, sound and game play are excellent and the multiple characters make for many ways to solve a particular problem, I will revisit levels once I complete it as the badges give unique challenges. Overall it's superb, and it runs on Linux :-)
Frustrating. But, I'm happy. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
It's Commandos with ninjas. If that sounds appealing to you, get it.

I saw this game pop up on steam out of nowhere and it peaked my interest.  After doing a little research and trying out the demo--there was no looking back. I don't typically pay full price for a game (though there was a modest 10% discount at time of purchase), but I was more than happy to do so here in support of the devs and publisher. Mimimi Productions did an outstanding job and I hope to see future DLC and titles based on this amazing and until recently, lost formula.  What a fun and refreshing game. Again, kudos Mimimi. Absolutely love it!
Great for fans of the old Commandos series.
A really great game, this is what a stealth game should be like!

I rarely write reviews, but Shadow Tactics was so special and heart-warming case that I felt I needed to say something, even if I just repeat words from other reviews.  As just about everyone before me, I highly recommend this for the fans of Commandos (1998) and Desperados (2001). For some reason, there hasn't been many games like this besides the sequels of aforementioned titles. That's probably why I've forgotten I've been yearning something like this.   Shadow Tactics really came out of nowhere. I tried the demo and immediately felt at home, and without a second thought I bought this. Deservedly so, most of the reviews of this game are positive, which gives me hope that there'll be some kind of continuation or just more games like this from other developers.  Pros: - An exemplary revival of the genre! - For the most part, the level design is incredibly well thought out - Every playable character is meaningful and fun to play with - Hardcore in a good way - patience is rewarded - Great replay value, especially if you want to achieve all the badges  Cons: - Loading times (though this didn't really bother me; I'm not the type who'll get easily frustrated) - Occasional hiccups in frame rate in some levels (@ 1440p, using GTX 980 and i7 6700K @ 4.6 GHz)
Great Game! Recommend it to all fans of Desperados.

An amazing!!! you're saying to yourself - Ok! these two guys and sleep... well, maybe this one as well... and you keep saying it for hours!!!  It really reminds commandos, but it not just copy! It has a spirit of Japan, new well-designed graphics, new tricks and it has an interesting story.  It's all about getting intelligence and assassination of noble lords! It's an AMAZING!!!)  recommend if you wanna try to fill yourself a lit bit ninja!=)

This is an impressively fun isometric stealth game, similar in gameplay to the Commandos series.  Playing as a shinobi (a ninja), a brutal Samurai, a sneaky thief, an assassin, or a wise old rifleman, every kill feels good and successfully executing a well thought out strategy is very satisfying, only to lead to the next set of foes.  The stealth element doesn't affect pacing, but make no mistake, this is a thinking game. Each level is a puzzle of guard movements and obstacles to overcome using the special skills of your available warriors.  The art direction is great and definitely draws you in. And while the graphics are not revolutionary, this is still a good looking game. Sound design is also good (you can play it in Japanese or in English, with a range of available subtitles, voice acting is solid. The story is interesting enough and serves its purpose.  I highly recommend this game.
A worthy spiritual successor to Commandos!   This game is just awesome, very addicting, if you on the fence about purchasing it just go play the demo and try it out.
Ifyou liked commando's you will like this one. The game is pretty hardcode and not easy, be prepared to reload a lot :)

At first I was a little skeptical, but I tried the Demo, and all doubts were removed. I was immediately enthralled and engaged. The game is tough and puzzling, even on the easier difficulties. The time period, environments, and personalities; all make for a great isometric tactical experience- but beware, it is difficult! Im still in the early stages of the story, yet the story is engaging and interesting from the very first area. I could go on, but others already have elaborated at great lengths as to the challenging fun experience this game offers. I fully recommend it!

I was going to wait this time around to actually finish the game before starting to write my review, but what the heck, Right? I enjoy writing about games, I enjoy playing them, etc...  So what is there to be said about Shadow Tactics, welp, i've heard plenty of people have compared this game to the 'Commandos' video game series, altho I cannot really vouch for this comparison, nor defy it, given the fact that i've never played the game, so many people have said it tho, that I might take their word for it and just simply say that this game is like a modern version of that series.  But really what I mostly enjoy about the game, besides the fact that simply this game is unique in every way, it's the simple fact that the game looks, sounds, and plays, beautifully, the game has this very distinctive cel shaded look to it, balanced with a lot of color, and a lot of detail, pair that with multiple video options, and you don't only have a pretty game, but also an optimized game at that.  The sound is nice, you can choose between multiple dialog options, as well as change the actual spoken language from english to japanese, or vice-versa, it's great really, i've been so far playing this game with the Japanese spoken voice, but with english subtitles, it adds (in my opinion) an amazing atmosphere besides the one that the game already creates with it's aesthetic.  The gameplay its really where its at for this game, the strategy and multiple abilities that your characters have are amazing, diverse, and unique in their usefulness, all of your characters share the basic core rulesets that the game has, but all of them also serve multiple purposes, so you can have in one mission a character who's an sniper, while in another you can have a character that can plant traps and climb through the rooftops of some buildings, it all works well, so far, it's enjoyable, and most importantly, it encourages a methodical and inteligent way of playing the game.  And an inteligent and methodical way of playing the game is right to say, the game it's incredibly challenging and puts an enourmous ammount of attention to 'trial and error' style of play, up to a point where there's a reminder to quick save your game that starts after a minute after the last quick save, a useful mechanic, some might say a bit annoying, but I say after playing, incredibly useful and necessary at that, you can however, if you want, disable the warning, as well as a whole other bunch of hud elements, as I said before, it is an incredibly optimized game for pc, in every use of the word, it doesn't only run well, it has multiple options through which you can customize your game so it can be the experience that your choosing to play.  So far I frankly don't regret my decision, having bought this game with a 10% discount, its just fine by me, I do believe that the people should wait for a while before purchacing this title, but that's just my recommendation.  Overall I really have enjoy what i've played so far, and I do recommend the game based on simply what i've experienced after playing for three hours, having completed three missions.

What a fantastic game.. After soo many years do companies put their greed aside and release a flawless game.. Not a single bug in the whole campaign.. Really enjoyed this game.. Hope many more to come

recommended if you liked commandos series..it's really close to that, the feudal japan setting is appealing and well executed. the character mechanics are also interesting enough. could use some improvements in complexity maybe, but i foresee a decent replayability(on mission 11 currently)

This is a well-designed and well-executed title that forces you to use your brain and be creative. No matter how smart you are, prepare to die, a lot. Did I say a lot? I meant A LOT. This never really makes you angry though, in fact it makes you want to keep playing, surprisingly.

It is 100% commandos in a different era with better graphic, story and new tricks. I saw it on steam played half the first level of demo then purchased instantly. Fantastic game for sure. Would recommend even at its price. There isnt many games out there like it nowadays.
If you enjoyed playing Commandos years ago, you will love playing Shadow Tactics!

Great one. Reminds me of Robin Hood game.  The best credit I give to is armorless Mugen. I mean: it's just a common sense for a samurai not to wear his armor all of the time; yet having an alternative model of Mugen was a pleasant surprise.  And no more 'must be my imagination' thing.
reminds me of comandos , come on game developer ! make more game like this !! :)

This is my only review here on steam after 9 years. I'm really enjoying this game. I've bought many games this year here on steam but have not really played them at all. This game is different, it has great setting, story and characters. Graphics are good and tention you feel while you are playing and trying not to be seen by soliders is really what keeps you wanting to play more.  I would not mind seeing expansion to this game and would probably buy it as well.
Fantastic game like commandos series.
Mac version! Commandos like !   You can install a third party driver for xbox one contorller, then you can play it on your mac with a Xbox One controller. :)
I've waited a ling time for a game thats this good again. After Desperados and Commandos there was nothing. Now finally I cant stop playing!  Thanks for the super cool and smooth gameplay!

If you liked Commandos, Desperados or Robin Hood: The Legend of Sherwood, then this is for you. Extremely well done stealth based real-time tactics game. The only caveat I'd give is that it is quite unforgiving; I personally don't see that as a negative what-so-ever, but the game will require you to save often and think hard about how to tackle situations with the appropriate finesse.  This is a genre of games that I'd largely forgotten about, but after playing Shadow Tactics all I want is more.  Hightly recommended.

Haven't finished it yet, but I'm still going to leave a short review. As a long time fan of Commandos, Desperados and Robin Hood: Legend Of Sherwood, I really enjoy this game. It's pretty much exactly what those games were, but in a different setting and on a newer engine. This genre has been dead for far too long, and I am so glad it's back!  The graphics work very well, gameplay is smooth. Not a single crash yet, and I have only noticed one minor bug (Patrol-->ladder--> Yuki's trap). The story is okay, good enough but nothing special. A big plus for the quick-save timer, it has saved my ♥♥♥♥ plenty of times.
Nice Game, I give it two thumbs up.

An abosulte gem! The game is not only awesome at its main role - stealth tactical game, it has polished every other aspect - UI, storyline, controls, perfomance optimistaion, background music, actor voices, etc. I've enjoyed every minute of those 50+ hours it took me to complete the game. If you`re old enough to remember Commandos series, and you liked them - this is a nobrain instabuy for you. If that reference doesn't ring a bell, then it is a great example of stealth tactical genre games, which i advice you to try!   It even has a demo, god damn it! How many devs today make demos? Pure awesomeness, thats how the games should be done! The Games, i'd even say!

Hid 3 shinobi in an outhouse and ambushed 3 guards.  Hid 1 awesome samurai in the same outhouse and killed 5 guards simultaneously.   Great music, great strategy, very addictive, tests your strategy and timing skills.

This game brought back memories of Desperados and Commandos. The game is set in a beautiful Shogun era and it has Japanese voice acting. Solid real-time tactics and gorgeous looking. I have had FPS drop randomly - apart from that - the game is must MUST buy if you loved either of the games i mentioned at the top. Loving it!
FACT 1: Japanese Guards from the Edo period had no peripheral vision.
Hands down an amazing Game. Even though it is a bit pricey, the one of a kind experience you get from this unique game is worth every penny.

A well thought-out evolution of the Real-Time Tactics genre. Feels really slick. Interesting new UI and gameplay decisions.  Still doesn't quite beat out my favorite game in the genre (Robin Hood) in terms of breadth of choice, both tactical and bigger-picture (who to take on a mission, which missions to do), and fun optional things to do within the levels (e.g. robbing the rich, rescuing/recruiting allies, other reasons to explore the level). But probably my second favorite now!
this game is fun reminds me of the classic 1998 commandos game! if you are a fan of steath tatics games i really recommend this game

After Playing a number of hours I am pleased to say that I am very happy purchasing this game. Brings back good times of Commandos but in a beautiful environment. Multiple ways to battle through the levels that are bautiful and hard. I hope they make an expansion to this title because it is that good and I would buy it in an instant. Go for it!

If you like challenges, thinking, cheesy lines, characters, and Japan then this is the game for you! I would like to se a sequel just to see these characters again. They really grow on you. It is one of the best games of 2016! I just loved this game!

for anybody who is a fan of the old commando games or just want a really good strategy game and a very indepth story and dialogue this game is just right for you. the game offers many challenges in all of the maps. a challenge that on first glance on every map may look impossible or very unlikely of completion your first time there. i highly recommend this to any who like challenges or just very good strategy games
